articles.description: Paramount’s Smile is positively grinning ear-to-ear as the horror pic from director Parker Finn saw a wild 19% upswing in holdovers at the international box office in its second frame. The weekend gross was $17.5M in 61 markets for a $40M offshore cume and $8…

articles.author: Tom Brueggemann
articles.title: ‘TÁR’ Sticks Its Landing, Joy for ‘Triangle of Sadness’: Specialized Box Office Is Back - IndieWire
articles.description: Cate Blanchett and the Cannes-winning drama kick off a period that’s both Oscar season and make-or-break for specialized exhibitors.
articles.content:
Using release strategies we haven’t seen in a long time, “TÁR” (Focus) and “Triangle of Sadness” (Neon) showed us that nearly three years of punishing blows didn’t kill off specialized films.
